oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-05-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 4, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Ernest Tubb mentions that Grand Ole Opry Week begins the next day (May 5, 1957). It is announced that this is the 917th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rod Brasfield; Hank Locklin; Del Wood; Ernest Tubb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ernest Tubb introduces Hank Locklin -- (I'm So Tired Of) Going Home All By Myself (Hank Locklin) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Del Wood -- Chinese Breakdown (Del Wood) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- Don't Forbid Me (Ernest Tubb) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Old Hickory Singers; Jackson, Tommy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Byrd, Billy; Locklin, Hank
